column1: 03FF7EB9-8069-4E5F-9B4B-718F323746BF#appfire#891F4CDD-EE6E-4D9E-91A3-8920787D53CE#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#87622625-3E3B-42E1-8B85-BCD49A35F075#appfire#891F4CDD-EE6E-4D9E-91A3-8920787D53CE#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#DD1CA506-2A55-4269-AD1A-B63DD08FD90C#appfire#891F4CDD-EE6E-4D9E-91A3-8920787D53CE#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-14 12:24:40.0#appfire#1
